revision.text:
{{Infobox website | name = Guest of a Guest | logo = GuestOfAGuestlogo.jpg | logo_size = 180px | url = {{official URL}} | commercial = Yes | type = Website | key_people =[[Rachelle Hruska]], [[chief executive officer|CEO]] | launch_date = 2008 | current_status = Active }}
'''Guest of a Guest''' is a website founded by [[Cameron Winklevoss]] and [[Rachelle Hruska]] that covers high society events, people, and places. Since its inception, Guest of a Guest has grown to include a picture database of thousands of people and events all over the world, with concentrations in New York City, the Hamptons, Los Angeles, Washington DC and Miami.<ref>Guest of a Guest http://guestofaguest.com/ GuestofaGuest.com</ref> ''[[Business Insider]]'' has described the site as "the new Page Six."<ref>{{cite news|work=Business Insider|title=A Day in the Life: 'Guest Of A Guest' Founder Rachelle Hruska|author=Noah Davis|date=2011|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/rachelle-hruska-guest-of-a-guest-day-in-the-life-2011-6#!IRTzn|accessdate=25 May 2014}}</ref>
The site has about 12 full-time employees and dozens of editors and photographers who cover local and international cultural events in places such as Miami, Chicago, London, Paris, and Berlin.<ref name=levo>{{cite news|publisher=Levo|title=Beyond the Pencil (Skirt): Meet Rachelle, Guest of a Guest|author=Kathryn Worsham|date=June 28, 2013|url=http://www.levo.com/articles/fashion/rachelle-hruska-guest-of-a-guest-styl|accessdate=25 May 2014}}</ref> Hruska serves as the [[chief executive officer]].
== History == Hruska met Winklevoss in 2005 in New York City while writing a blog about the city's nightlife when Winklevoss convinced her to take on Guest of a Guest as a full-time company.<ref name=levo/> The name Guest of a Guest originated when Rachelle Hruska noticed that many people on the party circuit did not own their own houses in the Hamptons. Instead, they crashed at other people's houses. "Everyone was a guest of a guest," she told the Wall Street Journal.<ref name="WSJ2012">{{cite web | url = https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052702303343404577519303397291564 | title = Party Site Founder Goes Solo | author = Heyman, Marshall | work = [[Wall Street Journal]] | date = July 11, 2012 }}</ref> Since the site's expansion to other major cities, the "guest of a guest" reference has taken on a new meaning, referring to how its users are receiving behind-the-scene images of the events.<ref>{{cite news|title=The Most Influential Women in Technology 2011 - Rachelle Hruska|author=David Zax|date=2011|url=http://www.fastcompany.com/3016991/women-in-tech-2011/the-most-influential-women-in-technology-2011-rachelle-hruska|accessdate=25 May 2014}}</ref> Guest of a Guest has hosted over fifteen thousand events since the website's founding.<ref name=guestofa>{{cite web|title=About|url=http://guestofaguest.com/about|accessdate=25 May 2014}}</ref> The digital media company describes its mission as aiming to build one of the largest searchable photo directories of both celebrity and non-celebrity guests at events.<ref name=guestofa/>
Hruska became the sole owner of Guest of a Guest in 2012 when she purchased Winklevoss's stake in the company.<ref>{{cite news|work=Wall Street Journal|title=Party Site Founder goes Solo|url=https://www.wsj.com/news/articles/SB10001424052702303343404577519303397291564?mg=reno64-wsj&url=http%3A%2F%2Fonline.wsj.com%2Farticle%2FSB10001424052702303343404577519303397291564.html|date=July 10, 2012|accessdate=25 May 2014}}</ref>
== Expansion == Guest of a Guest launched a Hamptons-centric site in the summer of 2008 with Los Angeles following in March 2010.<ref>The Guest Of A Guest LA Launch Party!, http://guestofaguest.com/los-angeles/announcements/the-guest-of-a-guest-la-launch-party GuestofaGuest.com</ref> Guest of a Guest first launched a daily newsletter in the summer of 2009.<ref name="nypost.com">{{cite web | url = http://www.nypost.com/seven/05242009/entertainment/fashion/blue_blogs_170713.htm | title = Blue Blogs: Meet The New Wave Of Great-Gatsbys--Web Scribes Who Chronicle The Rich And Almost Famous | author = Meltzer, Marisa | work = [[New York Post]] | date = May 24, 2009 }}</ref> In 2012, the website began to cover global cultural events such as [[Cannes]], [[Art Basel]], [[Paris Fashion Week]], and the [[Academy Awards|Oscars]].<ref name="observer">{{cite web | url = http://www.observer.com/2011/08/rachelle-hruska-plus-one-yes-the-guest-of-a-guest-founder-is-with-child/ | title = Rachelle Hruska Plus One! Yes, the Guest of a Guest Founder Is With Child | author = Freeman, Nate | work = [[observer.com|Observer]] | date = August 8, 2011 }}</ref>
== YSK == YSK (an acronym used for You Should Know) is a project Guest of a Guest undertook for both New York and San Francisco starting in 2014. YSK features creative power players from the worlds of art, fashion, media, and entertainment.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://guestofaguest.com/new-york/you-should-know|title=New York {{!}} Guest of a Guest {{!}} Category - undefined|website=Guest of a Guest|access-date=2016-03-05}}</ref> The feature provides editorial photos of each individual along with a short interview. The Los Angeles portion of YSK will be released in 2016.
Former YSK members include: * [[Nate Berkus]], interior designer * [[Estelle (musician)|Estelle]], recording artist * [[Todd Traina]], film producer * [[Fern Mallis]], fashion designer * [[Dan the Automator|Dan Nakamura]], hip hop producer * [[Cynthia Rowley]], fashion designer * [[Casey Neistat]], film director/producer * [[Mark McNairy]], fashion designer * [[Josh Ostrovsky]], pop culture commentator * [[Bibhu Mohapatra]], fashion designer * [[Amirah Kassem]], baker/florist * [[Minnie Mortimer]], fashion designer
